name: CreateIncidentType
description:
Create a new incident type in Datadog.

This tool is used to create a new incident type in Datadog, allowing users to define categories for managing incidents effectively.

parameters.name: incident_type_name
parameters.description: The name of the incident type to be created in Datadog.

value_schema.description: The name of the incident type.

parameters.name: incident_type_resource_type
parameters.description: Specifies the incident type resource type. Must be 'incident_types'.

parameters.name: incident_creation_timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp indicating when the incident type was created. Format should be ISO 8601.

value_schema.description: Timestamp when the incident type was created.

parameters.name: creator_user_id
parameters.description: A unique ID representing the user who created the incident type.

value_schema.description: A unique identifier that represents the user that created the incident type.

parameters.name: incident_type_description
parameters.description: Text that describes the incident type. Provide a clear, concise explanation to aid in management and identification.

value_schema.description: Text that describes the incident type.

parameters.name: last_modified_user_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the user who last modified the incident type.

value_schema.description: A unique identifier that represents the user that last modified the incident type.

parameters.name: last_modified_timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp indicating when the incident type was last modified. Use ISO 8601 format, e.g., '2023-10-01T14:30:00Z'.

value_schema.description: Timestamp when the incident type was last modified.

parameters.name: incident_title_prefix
parameters.description: The string prepended to the incident title throughout the Datadog app.

value_schema.description: The string that will be prepended to the incident title across the Datadog app.

parameters.name: set_as_default_incident_type
parameters.description: Set to true to make this the default incident type if no type is specified during incident creation.

value_schema.description: If true, this incident type will be used as the default incident type if a type is not specified during the creation of incident resources.
